name: GetActivityLogEntries
description:
Retrieve a list of activity log entries.

Use this tool to get a list of activity log entries from Calendly. This endpoint requires an Enterprise subscription.

parameters.name: organization_uri
parameters.description: The URI of the organization for which to return activity log entries.

value_schema.description: Return activity log entries from the organization associated with this URI

parameters.name: filter_by_search_term
parameters.description: Specify terms to filter log entries. Use operators like |, +, " ", -, (), *. Eg: "email@website.com" or (term1 + term2).

value_schema.description:
Filters entries based on the search term.

Supported operators:
  - `|` - to allow filtering by one term or another. Example: `this | that`
  - `+` - to allow filtering by one term and another. Example: `this + that`
  - `"` - to allow filtering by an exact search term. Example: `"email@website.com"`
  - `-` - to omit specific terms from results. Example: `Added -User`
  - `()` - to allow specifying precedence during a search. Example: `(this + that) OR (person + place)`
  - `*` - to allow prefix searching. Example `*@other-website.com`

parameters.name: actor_uris
parameters.description: An array of URIs for users whose entries should be returned. Include multiple URIs for multiple users.

value_schema.description: Return entries from the user(s) associated with the provided URIs

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Order results by the specified field and direction using {field}:{direction} format. Example: 'date:asc'.

value_schema.description: Order results by the specified field and direction. List of {field}:{direction} values.

parameters.name: include_entries_after_time
parameters.description: Include entries that occurred after this specified UTC time (e.g., "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z").

value_schema.description: Include entries that occurred after this time (sample time format: "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z"). This time should use the UTC timezone.

parameters.name: end_time_utc
parameters.description: Specify entries occurring before this UTC time (e.g., '2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z').

value_schema.description: Include entries that occurred prior to this time (sample time format: "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z"). This time should use the UTC timezone.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Provide the token to retrieve the subsequent portion of the activity log collection.

value_schema.description: The token to pass to get the next portion of the collection

parameters.name: number_of_rows_to_return
parameters.description: Specifies the number of activity log entries to return.

value_schema.description: The number of rows to return

parameters.name: entry_categories
parameters.description: Specify categories of activity log entries to retrieve.

value_schema.description: The categories of the entries

parameters.name: filter_by_actions
parameters.description: A list of actions to filter activity log entries. Provide actions associated with the entries.

value_schema.description: The action(s) associated with the entries

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the calendly API.

parameters.description: Return activity log entries from the organization associated with this URI

value_schema.description: Return activity log entries from the organization associated with this URI

  - `+` - to allow filtering by one term and another. Example: `this + that`
  - `"` - to allow filtering by an exact search term. Example: `"email@website.com"`
  - `-` - to omit specific terms from results. Example: `Added -User`
  - `()` - to allow specifying precedence during a search. Example: `(this + that) OR (person + place)`
  - `*` - to allow prefix searching. Example `*@other-website.com`

  - `"` - to allow filtering by an exact search term. Example: `"email@website.com"`

  - `()` - to allow specifying precedence during a search. Example: `(this + that) OR (person + place)`
  - `*` - to allow prefix searching. Example `*@other-website.com`

parameters.name: actor
parameters.description: Return entries from the user(s) associated with the provided URIs

value_schema.description: Return entries from the user(s) associated with the provided URIs

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Order results by the specified field and direction. List of {field}:{direction} values.

value_schema.description: Order results by the specified field and direction. List of {field}:{direction} values.

parameters.name: min_occurred_at
parameters.description: Include entries that occurred after this time (sample time format: "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z"). This time should use the UTC timezone.

value_schema.description: Include entries that occurred after this time (sample time format: "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z"). This time should use the UTC timezone.

parameters.name: max_occurred_at
parameters.description: Include entries that occurred prior to this time (sample time format: "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z"). This time should use the UTC timezone.

value_schema.description: Include entries that occurred prior to this time (sample time format: "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z"). This time should use the UTC timezone.

value_schema.description: The token to pass to get the next portion of the collection

parameters.description: The number of rows to return

value_schema.description: The number of rows to return
